results.p: A bromide ion is the negatively charged form (Br−) of the element bromine, a member of the halogens group on the periodic table. Most bromides are colorless ...
Jul 29, 2024 — 1. a binary compound of bromine with another element or a radical including some (such as potassium bromide) used as sedatives.

results.p: Bromide definition: a salt of hydrobromic acid consisting of two elements, one of which is bromine, as sodium bromide, NaBr.. See examples of BROMIDE used ...
A bromide is a common saying or proverb that is obvious and not that helpful, like "When life hands you lemons, make lemonade."
The primary pharmacologic action of bromide is a central nervous system (CNS) membrane-stabilizing effect that results in sedation and an elevated seizure ...
